title: Harrison Ford, 77, proves he's a perpetual hunk as he enjoys a bike ride around town
text:
Harrison Ford hasn't ditched his hunk credentials, even in his 70s.

And the Indiana Jones actor looked handsome as ever when he was seen riding his bike around the Pacific Palisades on Monday.

The 77-year-old actor looked as if he didn't have a care in the world while he made his way around the neighborhood to get to his local repair shop, Helen's Cycles.

Going the distance: Harrison Ford went bike riding through the Pacific Palisades on Monday

Harrison looked sharp in an olive green tee and dark denim. He made sure to shade his eyes with sunglasses while black leather shoes and a watch completed his look.

While the Blade Runner star left his house without protection, he was later seen sporting a red bike helmet for the ride.

Keeping prepared, he had a backpack full of essentials to the rear.

Protect your neck! While the Blade Runner star left his house without protection, he was later seen sporting a red bike helmet for the ride

Ready for anything: Keeping prepared, he had a backpack full of essentials to the rear

Back in 2016, Disney announced a fifth Indiana Jones movie was happening, with Ford returning as Indy and Steven Spielberg directing.

Screenwriter David Koepp was brought on to write the script at that point, but the release date was pushed several times with writers Lawrence Kasdan (Rogue One: A Star Wars Story) and Dan Fogelman (This Is Us) coming aboard to write the script.

But in a new interview with Den of Geek, Koepp revealed he was working on it again, though it isn't known when production may actually happen.

Indiana Jones: Back in 2016, Disney announced a fifth Indiana Jones movie was happening, with Ford returning as Indy and Steven Spielberg directing. Harrison is seen above in September

'I’m working on it again. We’re still trying. And I think we’ve got a good idea this time. We’ll see,' Koepp said of Indiana Jones 5, which at the moment is set for release on July 5, 2021.

Ford hasn't been acting much as of late, only appearing in 2017's Blade Runner 2049 and 2015's Star Wars: The Force Awakens as his last two live-action movies.

He also lent his voice to Rooster in The Secret Life of Pets 2 and he'll next be seen in Call of the Wild with Karen Gillan, Dan Stevens and Bradley Whitford on February 21, 2020.

Sporadic actor: Ford hasn't been acting much as of late, only appearing in 2017's Blade Runner 2049 and 2015's Star Wars: The Force Awakens as his last two live-action movies

Ford appeared in front of the United Nations General Assembly on Monday to make a plea to finally save the rain forest, instead of just talking about doing so.

'We've been talking about saving the Amazon for about 30 years ago,' Ford began. 'The world's largest rain forest, the Amazon, is crucial to any climate change solution.'

He then addressed the recent fires in the rain forest, with a passionate plea, stating, 'When a room in your house is on fire, you don't say there's a fire in a room in your house you say my house is on fire, and we only have one house.'
